task:
Using latch://38438.account/Scratch/vizgen/vizgen_mouse_brain_aging_leiden_no_celltype.h5ad and var['feature_name'], identify astrocytes and distinguish an aging/inflammation-associated astrocyte state from baseline astrocyte states based on expression and clustering. Select a SMALL SET of significantly enriched marker genes for the aging-associated astrocyte state and report them as a JSON list of uppercase gene symbols under the key top_marker_genes. Limit the total number of markers to at most 10.

Return EXACTLY:
<EVAL_ANSWER>{"top_marker_genes": ["GENE1", "GENE2", "GENE3", ...]}</EVAL_ANSWER> (no extra keys or fields).

config.description: Passing requires that at least half of the canonical aging/inflammation-associated astrocyte markers (Gfap, C4b) are recovered among the returned markers; extra non-canonical markers are allowed.

notes: From Fig 2Bâ€“C: the Astro-2 state increases in abundance in old animals and exhibits upregulation of Gfap and C4b, consistent with inflammation/aging-activated astrocytes. Sub-clustering astrocytes and performing marker detection should reveal an aging-associated astrocyte cluster whose top markers include Gfap and C4b.
